articles.author: Yen Nee Lee
articles.title: India’s worsening Covid crisis could spiral into a problem for the world - CNBC
articles.description: The South Asian country accounted for 46% of new coronavirus cases globally and one in every four deaths in the past week, said the World Health Organization.
articles.content:
A woman wearing mask as a precaution against Covid-19 stands in a crowded area near India Gate, in New Delhi on March 19, 2021 as coronavirus cases continue to increase across India.

articles.title: Man Arrested In San Francisco Stabbing Of 2 Asian Women - NPR
articles.description: The two women, aged 84 and 63, were attacked while waiting at a bus stop on Tuesday, police said. It's the latest in a string of nationwide violence against Asian Americans during the pandemic.
articles.content:
Protesters held a rally in March at San Francisco's Embarcadero Plaza in solidarity with Asian Americans who have recently been the targets of hate crimes across the United States.

articles.author: Sarah Mullins
articles.title: SA's Legislative Council passes voluntary euthanasia bill, Lower House to have the final vote - ABC News
articles.description: Two thirds of South Australia's Legislative Council voted in favour of the voluntary euthanasia bill, which will now move to the state's Lower House for a final vote — the 17th attempt to pass such laws in the state.
articles.content:
South Australia is one step closer to legalising voluntary euthanasia after the state's Upper House voted in support of the voluntary assisted dying bill.
Key points:
